newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh taka ends higher on dollar supply.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh taka ends higher on dollar supply.

text.p: The Bangladesh taka closed higher on Wednesday at 42.2000/42.2300 to the dollar in interbank trading compared with the previous close of 42.2350/42.2450, dealers said.

They said the taka gained further on higher inflow of dollars through remittances after opening firmer at 42.2300/42.2400. "There was lack of demand for dollars in the market because of its adequate supply," said a dealer.
Dealers said the interbank call money rates closed lower at 4.25 percent to 4.75 percent against the previous 4.25-5.25 percent.
